subject: Sleep
title: Jet Lag and Clock Confusion
description: One-minute skill: Jet Lag and Clock Confusion.

hook.text: You land in Tokyo after a 12-hour flight. It's noon but your body screams that it's midnight.

buildup.text: Your SCN is still locked to your home time zone. Every organ is running on the old schedule.

discovery.text: Jet lag happens because your master clock can only shift about one hour per day.

twist.text: Flying east is harder than flying west because your clock naturally runs longer than 24 hours.

climax.text: Until your clock resets, digestion, alertness, and hormones all fire at the wrong times.

punchline.text: Your body arrives days after you do.

quiz.question: Why is eastward travel harder for jet lag?
options: Your clock naturally runs longer than 24 hours
Eastern time zones have more sunlight
